lexUnit.name: alarming.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: bringing about a state of alarm or worry

sentence.text: An even more alarming threat throughout the world is the growth in the incidence , and the accompanying high death rate associated with AIDS ( acquired immune deficiency syndrome ) .
The 39-year-old Scot 's worries increased after more alarming defensive lapses led to Saturday 's defeat .
Yet these proportions mask a more alarming phenomenon : the amount of new money that needs to be borrowed each year purely to pay off maturing debt .
It does not , however , match the most alarming predictions made two months ago when Easoe and Nasa , the US space agency , released preliminary measurements of ozone destruction .

It is all too common to find schools without stores , classrooms without cupboards , books without covers and a quite alarming rate of materials loss in schools often bearing little relationship to the official ` life expectancy " of materials on which the cost of replacements are calculated .

But he said the province was now faced with ` a quite alarming series of incidents , which perhaps marks a new phase in the terrorist campaign , and it has serious implications for people in Northern Ireland . "
Despite this rather alarming fact , essential oils are harmless to skin if used correctly as advocated in this book .
Most problems will fall short of these rather alarming possibilities , but they are likely to be more complicated in themselves .
` I 'm going to speak very plainly , " he said in that same quiet and rather alarming tone .
She was swaying between a long-lost dream and the rather alarming vision of reality .
She sat abruptly on the bed , suddenly feeling the strain of the rather alarming excursion into the night .
The committee reported in February 1943 in very alarming language that there would be nothing left for the British postwar aircraft industry unless something were done at once .
The ruinous state of the fortifications of many of our seaport towns , so likewise the open and defenceless posture of many others , at present seems to suggest some very alarming reflections .
But it is alarming how often the professionals take over .
This is not a Somalia situation , but it is very alarming . "
It has never been the policy of National Parks to accept large housing estates , but applications for tourist complexes are now cropping up with alarming frequency at planning meetings .
The ramp , for instance , needs to be of the correct gradient , something which , in my experience of discussing such matters with colleagues , appears to be overlooked with alarming frequency !
The Government have used the guillotine in a way that no other Government have -- with alarming frequency and absolute severity .

But with the industry in recession , and record sales dropping , the hitherto dependable cashflow was trickling down at an alarming rate .
In its report titled the Lost Land published today , it claims our countryside is disappearing at an alarming rate .
The prospects of success withered with alarming speed .
Forecasts about the course of democracy tend to swing from optimism to despair with alarming speed .
With alarming speed a large moth dashed at the candle , repeatedly and frantically , as if attached to it by elastic cord .
The domestic Cold War began in earnest in Britain with a series of alarming spy cases .
His son was obsessive about music , mastering classical , folk and rock modes with alarming rapidity .

They had always found buccaneering terribly alarming , and felt seasick at the slightest sign of bad weather .
Comparing them with such stupid birds made them less alarming , somehow less powerful .
